page.title: 02Arts & Crafts in Gwyddelwern
page.content: There are a wealth of arts and crafts which are pursued in the homes of the Gwyddelwern people. We have a farmers wife who produces beautiful{pencil sketches}and others who do{water colour paintings}and make {corn dollies. Following courses held in the village people have taken up{crocheting, {dressmaking, knitting, lampshade {making, macrame, patchwork and pottery {painting.}In the village we have 2 men who work with wood as a hobby, one of them makes{walking sticks}and the other{rustic benches,}both using local wood. The children of the village are encouraged to learn arts & crafts at an early age in school, producing works of{embroidery, {knitting, patchwork, soft toys, and {painting}which are entered in Eisteddfods. Barbara F. Luke.
